title: Lost and Found Reminder Before Winter Break
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
zoom_out_map
            
Lost and Found
Our lost and found is filling up! Please encourage your student to visit the lost and found if they have misplaced a lunchbox or article of clothing. Any items not claimed by winter break will be donated.Also, please make sure your child's name is written on the tag so that we can ensure lost items get back to students. Thank you!

summary: The **lost and found is filling up** with lunchboxes and clothing items. Students who have misplaced items should check the lost and found soon. **Any unclaimed items will be donated after winter break.** Parents are reminded to **label their child's belongings with their name** to help return lost items.

title: Food Resources Available for Families
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Social 

Work 

Spotlight

Social Work Spotlight
Please click the photo above for more Talawanda resources.

summary:
Due to uncertainty about SNAP benefits in November, Talawanda is sharing food resource options:
- **Little Free Pantry** - Located outside main entrance at Bogan, restocked daily
- **Backpack Program** - Small bag of food for students every Thursday
- **Family Food Boxes** - Can be picked up or delivered within 24 hours
- **Community Pantries** - Additional resources linked in the flyer

For help accessing these resources, contact Emily White, Bogan Social Worker at 513-273-3403 or whitee@talawanda.org

title: Cafeteria Lunch Accounts and November Menus
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Lunch Accounts
As a reminder, you are able to add funds to your student's lunch account through the PaySchool Central. If your student's account reaches -$50 it will be rolled into your school fees. Please be mindful and keep your student's account current.

November Menus
Here are the breakfast and lunch menus for November!

summary:
**Lunch account reminders:** Add funds through PaySchool Central. Accounts that reach -$50 will be rolled into school fees, so please keep accounts current.

**November menus are now available** for breakfast and lunch. The breakfast menu includes items like Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast, Breakfast Bowls, Chocolate Donut Holes, Sausage & Cheese Biscuit Sandwiches, and more throughout the month. 100% fruit juice, assorted fruit selection, and milk are included with every breakfast. The cafeteria is closed November 24-25 and 27-28 for Thanksgiving break.

title: Kiwanis Holiday Food Drive for TOPSS
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education
summary:
Bogan K-Kids is collecting donations for the **Kiwanis Holiday Food Drive** to benefit families served by TOPSS (Talawanda Oxford Pantry and Social Services). Donations can be brought to Bogan **October 27th-November 7th**. 

Requested items include:
- Canned Green Beans
- Cream of Mushroom Soup
- Cream of Chicken Soup
- Baking Mixes
- Mac & Cheese
- Crispy Onions
- Hygiene Products (Shampoo, Soap, Toothpaste, Deodorant, etc.)

Contact Ms. Currier or Mrs. Bryan with questions.

title: 2025-2026 Yearbook Sales Now Open
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
2025-2026 Yearbook
We are starting yearbook sales early this year! Please use the link below and the code to order your yearbook!

summary:
Yearbook sales for the **2025-2026 school year** have started early! 

**Order deadline: March 25th**

**Yearbook ID Code:** 8480626

Order online at **ybpay.lifetouch.com** or scan the QR code on the flyer to purchase your yearbook and capture a year of memories.

title: When to Stay Home from School
source_title: Bogan Weekly News | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
Updated October 24th
Hi Bogan Families!Cold and flu season are officially here and I wanted to share with you the guidelines on when to keep your sick children at home. This chart touches on more than just cold and flu but is a good reminder to all when we need to stay home and when we are able to return back to school. Please be sure if your child is out sick to call and let our attendance line know they will not be at school. Also, if your child has a doctor's note for excused days, have your child drop that off to the front office.Please click the photo below for information from the CDC.

summary: Cold and flu season guidelines for keeping sick children home have been updated. **Stay home if your child has:** a fever of 100Â°F or higher, frequent/continual coughing or difficulty breathing, diarrhea or vomiting, body rash with fever, active head lice, eye infection with discharge, or sore throat with congestion. **Return to school when:** fever-free for 24 hours without medication, symptoms are improving, and specific condition requirements are met (e.g., 24 hours after starting antibiotic eye drops, tolerating food for 12 hours after vomiting). If your child is absent, call the attendance line and submit any doctor's notes to the front office. For COVID-19, students can return when fever-free for 24 hours without medication and symptoms are minimal and improving.
